intro: Hydrophyllum pinnatifidum, commonly known as the narrowleaf waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as stream banks and meadows. It produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Hydrophyllum pinnatifidum is often found in montane and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid environments.
